title: Vault Commands Structure Refactoring
details:
**Refactoring Request**: Make vault commands consistent with video-notes and pdf-notes command structure.

**Previous Structure** (multi-subcommand):
- `na.exe vault generate-index <path>`
- `na.exe vault ensure-metadata <path>`
- `na.exe vault clean-index <path>`

**New Structure** (single commands like video-notes/pdf-notes):
- `na.exe vault-generate-index <path>`
- `na.exe vault-ensure-metadata <path>`
- `na.exe vault-clean-index <path>`

**Implementation Details**:
- Changed from subcommand structure to individual top-level commands
- Each command follows the same pattern as VideoCommands.cs and PdfCommands.cs
- Made Register method static and created separate registration methods for each command
- Each command has proper dependency injection setup and error handling
- Updated all tests to reflect new command structure

**Files Modified**:
- `d:\source\notebook-automation\src\c-sharp\NotebookAutomation.Cli\Commands\VaultCommands.cs` - Complete refactoring
- `d:\source\notebook-automation\src\c-sharp\NotebookAutomation.Cli\Cli\CommandLineBuilder.cs` - Updated to call static Register method
- `d:\source\notebook-automation\src\c-sharp\NotebookAutomation.Cli.Tests\Commands\VaultCommandsTests.cs` - Updated tests for new structure

**Testing Results**:
- `na.exe vault-generate-index` ✅ Shows detailed usage when no args provided
- `na.exe vault-ensure-metadata` ✅ Shows detailed usage when no args provided
- `na.exe vault-clean-index` ✅ Shows detailed usage when no args provided
- All commands appear in main help list alongside video-notes and pdf-notes ✅

**Status**: ✅ COMPLETED - Vault commands now follow consistent pattern with video/pdf commands
